communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Under the Montana Public Records Act § 2-6-1001 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of the following records:

1. Any digital communications among and between Montana Department of Justice (DOJ) employees concerning or relating to SB 544 of the 2023 legislative session, including without limitation, calendar entries, telephone logs, emails, text messages, agendas, minutes, or notes as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents). 

2. Any digital communications between DOJ employees and individuals outside of the DOJ concerning or relating to SB 544 of the 2023 legislative session, including without limitation, calendar entries, telephone logs, emails, text messages, agendas, minutes, or notes as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents). 

3. Any digital communications among and between DOJ employees concerning or relating to HB 349 of the 2023 legislative session, including without limitation, calendar entries, telephone logs, emails, text messages, agendas, minutes, or notes as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents). 

4. Any digital communications between DOJ employees and individuals outside of the DOJ concerning or relating to HB 349 of the 2023 legislative session, including without limitation, calendar entries, telephone logs, emails, text messages, agendas, minutes, or notes as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents). 

5. With regard to the document titled “DOJ responsibilities breakdown,” which Policy Advisor Alex Sterhan emailed to Representative Alan Doane and Project Manager Laura Schultz and copied to Chief of Staff Will Selphon on June 28, 2023: 
- All documents that discuss or relate to the purpose of preparing the “DOJ responsibilities breakdown” document; 
- All documents identifying or relating to factors considered when determining if a bill should be included under the headings, “Direct DOJ Impact”, "Potential DOJ Fiscal Impact", or "Minimal DOJ Impact"; 
- All emails sent or received within the Department of Justice that discuss, attach, or relate to the document “DOJ responsibilities breakdown”; 
- All emails sent or received to individuals outside the Department of Justice that discuss, attach, or relate to the document “DOJ responsibilities breakdown”; and 
- All documents that demonstrate which division heads reviewed or provided input into the bills to be included in “DOJ responsibilities breakdown”.  

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alison Boden

To Whom It May Concern:

Under the Montana Public Records Act § 2-6-1001 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of all documents relating meetings or telephone calls between Representative Sheldon-Galloway's office and others relating to HB 349 of the 2023 legislative session, including without limitation, calendar entries, telephone logs, emails, text messages, agendas, minutes, or notes as well as documents and presentations, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents). 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,
Alison Boden

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,
Alison Boden

Alison Boden

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI fingerprinting
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files, memos, communications, publications, or any additional documentation the FBI’s International Fingerprint Exchange program between 1930 and 1944.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Guariglia
